item.title: Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds ‘NiGHTS Content Drop’ update launches December 24
item.content:encoded:
SEGA will release the “NiGHTS Content Drop” update for Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds on December 24 at 4:00 p.m. PT / 7:00 p.m. ET, the company announced.

The update will include the following content:

  • NiGHTS as a playable character
  • NiGHTS’ vehicle, Dream Sleeper
  • Special emotes and sounds

Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

item.title: Cronos: The New Dawn to add easier difficulty option ‘Temporal Diver Mode’ in early 2026
item.content:encoded:
Bloober Team has announced “Temporal Diver Mode,” a new, easier difficulty option coming to third-person survival horror game Cronos: The New Dawn in early 2026.

“Cronos: The New Dawn was a game developed to challenge the players,” Bloober Team said in the announcement. “But we heard your voices and we know that some of us want to explore the story behind the game in your own pace. So right now we’re working on a new difficulty setting that will be introduced in early 2026. Such is our calling.”

Cronos: The New Dawn is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

item.title: POSTAL 4: No Regerts ‘Free Roam, Free Regert’ update now available for PS5, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5

Free roam and over 150 new additions, updates, and improvements.

Running With Scissors has released the POSTAL 4: No Regerts “Free Roam, Free Regert” update, which adds free roam and over 150 new additions, updates, and improvements to the PlayStation 5 and PC versions, the developer announced.

Here is an overview of the update, via Running With Scissors:

The “Free Roam, Free Regert” update introduces Free Roam Mode for unfettered chaos and over 150 new additions, updates, and improvements to the base game.

Experience a raw hit of POSTAL 4‘s small town Edensin in Free Roam Mode, delivering uncut access to the POSTAL Dude like never before. Traverse the streets during an endless day, completing side quests and errands, roaming different districts to snag collectables, and pissing (people off) in creative ways, utilizing POSTAL‘s signature over-the-top arsenal. Free Roam Mode expands on the base game’s open-ended sandbox by serving up a steaming slice of non-linearity.

In addition to Free Roam Mode, the update adds a metric shit-ton of additions, fixes, and improvements, including:

  • New and Improved Weapon Textures – The Desert Eagle, AK, Revolver, FOURnicator, and all other weapons have never looked better.
  • Errand Updates – Sell garden gnomes in Gnome Hunter, tackle Animal Catcher’s non-violent route, seek sign-ups in Volunteer Petition, and get artistic during Tag Turf Returns.
  • Dismemberment – Lethal and non-lethal NPC dismemberment is now available. Lop off a leg and watch NPCs hop.
  • NPC Improvements – Edensin’s residents now piss their pants when electrocuted and have a host of new knockdown animations.
  • More Weapon Cosmetics – Cause chaos in style with new weapon cosmetics, including the Kommander Karl Originals, available at the Skinporium.
  • Level Design Improvements – Updates to destructible doors, asset LOD and pop-in, and more for a smoother experience
  • And many more…

POSTAL 4: No Regerts is available now for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam, GOG, and Green Man Gaming.
